title: Judgement Can Be Cast for Nonexistant Disputes
content:
**Update**
Marked as "Fixed" by the client. Addressed in: `d4eecd98daaf4c2f0d17beb1eba6c341a69f481c`.

**File(s) affected:**`DisputeModule.sol`

**Description:** Disputes can be raised by anyone for a token suspected of infringing on intellectual property. The token owner is then given time to assert counterevidence. After some cooldown period, the contract administrator is able to cast judgement on the dispute, deciding either in favor of the initiator or the token owner. However, due to bad input validation and enum default states, the `setDisputeJudgement()` function can be called for any token ID, those without associated dispute and even unminted tokens.

```
if (dispute.status != DisputeStatus.Raised && dispute.status != DisputeStatus.Asserted) revert InvalidDisputeStatus();
```

Further, casting judgement pays out some reward with funds associated with other disputes. In turn, the contract may eventually run out of funds, causing a DoS on judgements and requiring the owner to equalize these losses.

**Recommendation:** Set the default enum state of `DisputeStatus` to `Uninitialized`, by listing this as the first option.

```
enum DisputeStatus {
    Uninitialized, // <-- new default value of this enum
    Raised, // <-- previous default value, passing the input validation
    Asserted,
    Resolved,
    Cancelled
}
```
